item.title: 达里奥认为美联储降息四分之一是债权人的 "正确选择
item.description: 布里奇沃特联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）表示，从美国经济的整体情况来看，美联储本周的降息幅度可能较小。【原文：Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio said the overall picture of the US economy probably warrants a smaller interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this week.】

item.title: 美联储减息对亚洲日元和新兴市场影响最大
item.description: 人们普遍预期美联储本周将转向降息，这很可能会支持亚洲新兴市场资产，进一步扩大其近期对日本和芯片股等全球热门股的领先优势。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s widely anticipated pivot to interest-rate cuts this week is likely to bolster emerging Asian market assets, further extending their recent lead over global favorites such as Japan and chip stocks.】

item.title: Animoca 萧泓称香港是可能进行首次公开募股的有力竞争者
item.description: 加密风险投资者和区块链游戏开发商Animoca Brands Corp.董事长萧逸表示，香港是其潜在上市的 "有力竞争者"。【原文：Hong Kong is a “strong contender” for a potential listing of crypto venture investor and blockchain game developer Animoca Brands Corp., its Chairman Yat Siu said.】

item.title: 美联储降息将成为亚洲各国央行的发令枪
item.description: 在经历了两年多的货币痛苦之后，随着美联储将于周三将利率下调四分之一个百分点，亚洲各国央行将得到一些缓解。不过，亚洲地区自身货币政策的道路将从此崎岖不平。【原文：After more than two years of currency pain, Asia’s central banks are in for some relief as the Federal Reserve is set to cut interest rates by a quarter-point Wednesday. The path for the region’s own monetary policy, though, will be bumpy from here.】

item.title: 交易员远离与莫迪有关联的股票，转向防御性股票
item.description: 印度投资者正在回避那些有望从总理纳伦德拉-莫迪的连任中获益的股票，转而投向防御性行业。【原文：Investors in India are shunning stocks that were expected to benefit from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s re-election, and instead piling into defensive sectors.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 与美联储降息预期挂钩的创纪录赌注面临大幅亏损的风险。对在 Archegos 倒闭案中损失惨重的银行的法律审查正在加强。史蒂夫-科恩即将离开交易大厅。【原文：Record wagers tied to the Fed’s expected rate cut risk sharp losses. Legal scrutiny of banks that lost big on the Archegos collapse ramps up. Steve Cohen is stepping away from the trading floor. —Nicole Bullock】

item.title: 中东局势紧张，美国库存成为焦点，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于交易商评估了中东日益加剧的紧张局势、好坏参半的美国库存报告以及美联储利率政策的可能走向，石油在收于两周多来的最高点后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after closing at the highest in more than two weeks as traders assessed rising tensions in the Middle East, a mixed US stockpiles report, and the likely course of Federal Reserve interest-rate policy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行将重点关注数字货币批发而非零售
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行表示，鉴于零售版数字货币可能带来的益处不大，但也有潜在的复杂性，因此将重点关注中央银行批发版数字货币的可能用例。【原文：The Reserve Bank of Australia said it will focus on the possible use cases for a wholesale central bank digital currency given the modest likely benefits and potential complications from a retail variant.】

item.title: 纽森表示担心人工智能法案的 "寒蝉效应
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）表示，他担心州议会通过的一项监管新技术的法案可能会对人工智能的发展造成 "寒蝉效应"。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom said he is concerned about a potential “chilling effect” on the development of artificial intelligence posed by a bill to regulate the new technology passed by the state legislature.】

item.title: Bausch Health 借助杰富瑞进行债务再融资，协助分拆上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，博士伦健康公司（Bausch Health Cos.）正在与杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group）合作，探讨对其部分债务进行再融资，以帮助分拆计划已久的博士伦眼科护理公司（Bausch + Lomb）股权。【原文：Bausch Health Cos. is working with Jefferies Financial Group to explore refinancing some of its debt to aid a long-planned spinoff of its stake in the eye-care company Bausch + Lomb, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 市场综述：日本股市将上涨，交易员等待美联储和日本央行的动向
item.description: 在美国基准股市创下新纪录之后，日本股市周三早盘有望上涨。【原文：Stocks in Japan are poised for gains early Wednesday after the US benchmark hit a fresh record ahead of hotly anticipated central bank meetings in both countries.】

item.title: 关于 Nvidia 芯片、人工智能炒作和未来的一切
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）成为全球三大最有价值公司之一，其股价大涨是基于一系列假设。其中一个假设是，由其半导体实现的人工智能应用将成为现代经济的特征。另一个假设是，Nvidia 及其依赖的分包商能够顺利满足对其设备的爆炸性需求。【原文：The blistering stock rally that’s made Nvidia Corp. one of the world’s three most valuable companies is based on a number of assumptions. One is that artificial intelligence applications made possible by its semiconductors will become features of the modern economy. Another is that Nvidia, and the patchwork of subcontractors upon which it relies, can meet the exploding demand for its equipment without a hitch.】

item.title: 掉期价格显示受挫交易商怀疑日本央行的利率信号
item.description: 在日本央行七月董事会会议后受到打击的投资者似乎不愿意接受日本央行最近发出的加息信号，掉期市场认为日本央行今年加息的可能性仅为三分之一。【原文：Investors who were burned in the aftermath of the Bank of Japan’s July board meeting appear unwilling to accept its recent signaling on interest rates, with the swaps market pricing only about a one-in-three chance of a hike this year.】

item.title: 东京地铁考虑实施股东福利计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，东京地铁公司可能会制定一项股东福利计划，以鼓励个人投资者长期持有该公司股票。【原文：Tokyo Metro Co. may create a shareholder benefits program to encourage individual investors to hold its stock for the long term, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Point72 的 Drossos 称，美联储减息将导致美元走软
item.description: Point72 资产管理公司（Point72 Asset Management）的策略师兼经济学家索菲亚-德罗索斯（Sophia Drossos）表示，随着美联储开始降低借贷成本，以及世界其他地区出现乐观迹象，美元正进入下行趋势。【原文：The US dollar is entering a downward trend as the Federal Reserve starts lowering borrowing costs and signs of optimism emerge in other parts of the world, according to Sophia Drossos, a strategist and economist at Point72 Asset Management.】

item.title: 市政借款人将在年底 "打破 "债券销售记录
item.description: 美国州政府和地方政府今年准备出售创纪录水平的债务，因为在条件仍然具有吸引力的情况下，借款人继续涌入市场。【原文：US state and local governments are poised to sell record levels of debt this year as borrowers continue to flood the market while conditions remain attractive.】

item.title: KKR 牵头为 USIC Holdings 提供 14 亿美元私人信用贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co. 的资本市场部门牵头为 USIC Holdings 进行了一次私人信贷融资，这家公用事业供应商利用这次融资偿还了广泛的银团债务。【原文：KKR & Co.’s capital markets arm led a private credit financing for USIC Holdings, which the public utility provider used to repay broadly syndicated debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 对冲基金巨头孕育出价值 140 亿美元的初创企业幼崽群
item.description:
对冲基金初创公司拥有大量投资者现金，但无法保证复制母公司的成功。【原文：

The hedge-fund startups have a lot of investor cash, but no guarantee of replicating their parent firms’ success.

】

item.title: 如果鲍威尔未能大展拳脚，创纪录的美联储减息押注将面临风险
item.description: 如果美联储官员选择标准规模的降息，那么那些锁定了与美联储周三降息预期相关的创纪录赌注的交易员们将面临大幅亏损的风险。【原文：Traders who are locked into record wagers tied to the Federal Reserve’s expected interest-rate cut Wednesday are risking sharp losses if officials opt for a standard-sized reduction.】

item.title: 拜伦-艾伦的媒体公司计划削减成本，因为债务即将到期
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，拜伦-艾伦（Byron Allen）的艾伦媒体集团（Allen Media Group）正在计划进一步削减成本，因为该公司正面临债务到期的问题，并已聘请了顾问。【原文：Byron Allen’s Allen Media Group is planning deeper cost cuts as it stares down debt maturities, and has retained advisers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: KKR 投资的 Livspace 首次实现盈利，迈向上市之路
item.description: 由 KKR & Co.和高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）支持的家居装饰和翻新平台 Livspace 预计将在 2025 年第一季度首次录得净收入，向首次公开募股迈出一步。【原文：Livspace, a home interiors and renovation platform backed by KKR & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc., expects to record its first net income in the first quarter of 2025 in a step toward an initial public offering.】

item.title: 贝莱德与微软将为人工智能投资融资 300 亿美元
item.description: 贝莱德公司和微软公司正联手投资数据中心和其他支持人工智能的基础设施。【原文：BlackRock Inc. and Microsoft Corp. are teaming up to invest in data centers and other infrastructure supporting artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 钻石背公司希望利用天然气为油区发电
item.description: 二叠纪盆地最大的石油公司之一 Diamondback 能源公司正在考虑利用其生产的部分天然气发电，以运行钻井和压裂作业。【原文：Diamondback Energy Inc., one of the Permian Basin’s biggest oil companies, is considering using some of the natural gas it produces to generate electricity to run drilling and fracking operations.】

item.title: 索尼加入日本推动加密货币发展的行列，要求放宽规则的呼声日益高涨
item.description: 娱乐巨头索尼集团公司（Sony Group Corp. ）是最新一家加入日本企业利用区块链技术大潮的公司，这一趋势给日本政府带来了挑战。【原文：Entertainment giant Sony Group Corp. is the latest company to jump onto a bandwagon of Japanese businesses seeking to tap blockchain technology, a trend that poses challenges for the nation’s government.】

item.title: 经纪人退还阿根廷幽灵债券利润 1,000 万美元
item.description: 当地一家经纪公司是阿根廷今年创纪录的比索债务置换交易中获得 20% 收益的投资者之一，该公司将从该交易中获得的近 1000 万美元利润返还给了政府。【原文：A local brokerage that was among investors who made 20% gains in Argentina’s record peso debt swap this year returned the nearly $10 million in profit it made from the deal to the government.】

item.title: 史蒂夫-科恩停止为 Point72 交易，标志着一个时代的结束
item.description: 史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）离开了交易大厅。【原文：Steve Cohen has stepped away from the trading floor.】

item.title: 冈德拉克认为美联储 "在曲线之后 "将降息半点
item.description: DoubleLine Capital 的杰弗里-冈德拉克（Jeffrey Gundlach）加入了越来越多的人的行列，他们打赌美联储将在周三以半个百分点的降息幅度启动其降息周期。【原文：DoubleLine Capital’s Jeffrey Gundlach joined the growing ranks of those wagering that the Federal Reserve will kick off its interest-rate cutting cycle with a half-percentage-point move on Wednesday.】

item.title: PS5 Pro 的价格令 PlayStation 诞生国大跌眼镜
item.description:
日本可能创造了 PlayStation 品牌，但最新一代游戏机的成本将把所有玩家排除在外，只有最铁杆的玩家除外。【原文：

Japan might have created the PlayStation brand, but the cost of the latest generation of console will exclude all but the most hardcore. 

】

item.title: 微软称拜登退出竞选后，俄罗斯的影响力活动转向哈里斯
item.description: 根据微软公司的最新研究，在乔-拜登总统结束重返白宫的竞选活动后，俄罗斯影响美国大选的努力转向了用篡改和误导性视频抹黑副总统卡马拉-哈里斯。【原文：After President Joe Biden ended his campaign to return to the White House, Russian efforts to influence the US election shifted to smearing Vice President Kamala Harris with doctored and misleading videos, according to new research from Microsoft Corp.】

item.title: 尽管加拿大矿业受到打击，中国紫金集团仍誓言继续投资加拿大矿业
item.description: 中国最有价值的矿业公司紫金矿业集团股份有限公司（Zijin Mining Group Co.【原文：Zijin Mining Group Co., China’s most valuable mining company, says it won’t be deterred by the Canadian government’s measures to limit foreign involvement in its mining sector.】
